turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Sirenia.
turn.1: What are the subfamilies of Sirenia?
turn.2: In 1994, the family was expanded to include not only the subfamily Trichechinae ("Potamosiren", "Ribodon", and "Trichechus"), but also Miosireninae ("Anomotherium" and "Miosiren").
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The African manatee and the West Indian manatee are more closely related to each other than to the Amazonian manatee.
turn.6: Dugongidae comprises the subfamilies Dugonginae and Hydrodamalinae (which are both monophyletic) and the paraphyletic Halitheriinae.
turn.7: Is there anything else notable about the subfamilies?
turn.8: The tusks of modern-day dugongs may have originally been used for digging, but they are now used for social interaction.
turn.10: The genus "Dugong" probably originated in the Indo-Pacific area.
turn.11: What other differences are there between the sirenia?
turn.12: The tail fluke of a dugong is notched and similar to those of dolphins, whereas the tail fluke of manatees is paddle-shaped.
